etymologies: Old English streccan, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch strekken and German strecken. The noun dates from the late 16th century

definitions: (of something soft or elastic) be made or be capable of being made longer or wider without tearing or breaking

examples.text: my sweater stretched in the wash
rubber will stretch easily when pulled

shortDefinitions: be made or be capable of being made longer or wider without tearing or breaking

definitions: cause (something) to become longer or wider by pulling it

examples.text: stretch the elastic
small squares of canvas were stretched over the bamboo frame

shortDefinitions: cause something to stretch by pulling it

definitions: straighten or extend one's body or a part of one's body to its full length, typically so as to tighten one's muscles or in order to reach something

examples.text: the cat yawned and stretched
stretching my cramped legs
we lay stretched out on the sand

shortDefinitions: straighten or extend one's body or part of one's body to its full length

definitions: extend or spread over an area or period of time

examples.text: the beach stretches for over four miles
the long hours of night stretched ahead of her

shortDefinitions: extend or spread over area or period of time

definitions: last or cause to last longer than expected

examples.text: her nap had stretched to two hours
stretch your weekend into a mini summer vacation

shortDefinitions: last or cause to last longer than expected

definitions: make great demands on the capacity or resources of

examples.text: the cost of the court case has stretched their finances to the limit

shortDefinitions: make great demands on capacity or resources of

definitions: cause (someone) to make maximum use of their talents or abilities

examples.text: it's too easy—it doesn't stretch me

shortDefinitions: cause someone to make maximum use of their talents or abilities

definitions: adapt or extend the scope of (something) in a way that exceeds a reasonable or acceptable limit

examples.text: to describe her as sweet would be stretching it a bit

shortDefinitions: adapt or extend scope of something in way that exceeds reasonable or acceptable limit

phrases.text: by no stretch of the imagination

definitions: an act of stretching one's limbs or body

examples.text: I got up and had a stretch

shortDefinitions: act of stretching one's limbs or body

definitions: the fact or condition of a muscle being stretched

examples.text: she could feel the stretch and pull of the muscles in her legs

shortDefinitions: fact or condition of muscle being stretched

definitions: a phase of a pitcher's delivery, during which the arms are raised above and behind the head.
shortDefinitions: phase of pitcher's delivery, during which arms are raised above and behind head

definitions: a shortened form of a pitcher's windup, typically used to prevent base runners from stealing or gaining a long lead.
shortDefinitions: shortened form of pitcher's windup

definitions: the capacity of a material or garment to stretch or be stretched; elasticity

examples.text: stretch jeans

shortDefinitions: capacity of material or garment to stretch or be stretched

definitions: a difficult or demanding task

examples.text: it was a stretch for me sometimes to come up with the rent

shortDefinitions: difficult or demanding task

definitions: a continuous area or expanse of land or water

examples.text: a treacherous stretch of road

shortDefinitions: continuous area or expanse of land or water

definitions: a continuous period of time

examples.text: long stretches of time

shortDefinitions: continuous period of time

definitions: a period of time spent in prison

examples.text: a four-year stretch for tax fraud

shortDefinitions: period of time spent in prison

definitions: a straight part of a racetrack, typically the homestretch

examples.text: he made a promising start, but faded down the stretch

shortDefinitions: straight part of racetrack

definitions: the distance covered on one tack.
shortDefinitions: distance covered on one tack

definitions: a stretch limo

examples.text: a chauffeur-driven stretch

shortDefinitions: stretch limo

phrases.text: by no stretch of the imagination
